post_content: üíÜ What is one item many of us use in our beauty regime daily? Single-use cotton pads.‚†Ä. ‚†Ä. We often use cotton pads to put on our toner or with make-up remover to take off make-up.‚†Ä. ‚†Ä. Cotton requires a large amount of pesticide and water to produce. Pesticides deplete soil quality and as a result, leach into water systems, affecting animals and people living near cotton farms. In addition, an overwhelming 20,000 litres of water is needed to produce only 1kg of cotton, according to the World Wildlife Fund (WWF).‚†Ä. ‚†Ä. That‚Äôs a lot of resources consumed for a single-use product!‚†Ä. ‚†Ä. But, don‚Äôt worry! Reducing the environmental impact of cotton is simple. You can easily replace single-use cotton pads with reusable ones. Alternatively, you could pour your toner into spray bottles, avoiding the cotton altogether!‚†Ä. ‚†Ä. Interested to know how you can be more sustainable? Follow the Sustainable Singapore Gallery on Facebook and Instagram at @ssgallery.sg!‚†Ä. .‚†Ä. .‚†Ä. .‚†Ä. .‚†Ä. #SustainableSingaporeGallery #MarinaBarrage #PUBSingapore #Singapore #ZeroWasteSG #SustainableSingapore #EcoTips #EnvironmentallyConscious #CottonPad #Cotton #Reusable #Reusables

*Stojo owners‚Äì can you help me out?*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Hi guys, I‚Äôm posting this from Tokyo. I didn‚Äôt want to make the trip so soon after returning from the last (it was about a month) but my friend moved to Tokyo end of last year and I wanted to visit, and I had expiring miles, and there was a redemption discount.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I used my @stojo today to get coffee to go for the first time in Tokyo. I googled for good coffee places and found @ntscoffeetokyo that‚Äôs near the hotel and went there specially for coffee ‚Äì it was good coffee, They also carry @huskeecup reusable coffee cups so I‚Äôm happy about that because I haven‚Äôt seen many people use reusable coffee cups in Tokyo.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. What I‚Äôm not so happy about is that when I‚Äôm done with my coffee, I‚Äôd like to collapse it and chuck it in my bag but imy Stojo leaks ‚Äì it seems to leak only with coffee (seldom water when I test) and only a little but a little is enough. Thankfully I have my strap so I don‚Äôt lose it when I‚Äôm out and can generally have my hands free for my subway card and phone. **What about you guys, Stojo owners? Do you have similar leaky issues with your cup? Or is it just me and how do you do it? Please let me know!!! üôè**. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Thanks a bunch for your help! ü•∞. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #bringyourown #reusables #reusablecoffeecup #coffee #reusablecup #coffeecupstrap #coffeecupcarrier #coffeecupholder #zerowastecoffee #zerowasteonthego #zerowaste #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reusable #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #butfirstcoffee #zerowastemaker #coffeecupholder #coffeetogo #stojo #tinkerboxinthewild #zerowastetravelhack #singaporeexpats #sgexpats #expatsg #expatsingapore #singaporeexpatwives

*Parts of a reusable pad and what they look like*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Over the last week or so, I realised that I‚Äôve always shown you the pretty side of my pads and pantyliners ‚Äì that‚Äôs the *backing* or *back* side that comes into contact with your underwear. I‚Äôve also been asked if there are sticky dots on the backing; in my design there aren‚Äôt. This is because I don‚Äôt use synthetic fabric, which has a component of plastic in them and and tends to be slippery. My pads and liners generally stay in place as long as your undies are well-fitting and snug.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Next is the pad *topper* ‚Äì the side that comes into contact with your skin. Different cloth pad makers use different materials; mine is soft unbleached cotton. There are many grades of cotton and the one I‚Äôve selected is really soft and smooth on the skin. Being unbleached, it‚Äôs also less treated (all cloth has to be treated during manufacturing but unbleached would have skipped bleaching and the subsequent dyeing/printing of the pattern), and so is kinder to your skin, especially where your skin is thinner and more delicate (think the opposite of the skin on your feet).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. And we have the *core* inside that you don‚Äôt see, that absorbs your flow. I use various weights and types of cotton as natural fabrics are breathable, which makes wearing it more comfortable (less heat and moisture buildup) and healthy (less bacterial build up).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. No hidden plastic layer. No synthetic fabric! ü§ó. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I hope you found seeing the other side of pads and pantyliners useful! ü§óüíõ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #periods #reusableperiodproducts #clothpads #rumps #reusablepads #reusablepantyliners #reusablemenstrualproducts #unbleachedcotton #100percentcotton #saynotodisposable #saynotosingleuse #plasticfreeperiod #unbleachedcotton #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowaste #zerowasteinspo #flatlay #shopeco #ecoalternatives #reusable #reusables #reusablealternatives #singleusealternatives #singaporeexpats #sgexpats #expatsg #expatsingapore #singaporeexpatwives #bekindtoplanetearth

*Keeping bread fresh for longer*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My household is a two-hooman üë´-one-dog üê∂ one while we love freshly baked bread, we can only finish about half a loaf of sour dough every 2-3 days (this is partly because I don‚Äôt eat much for breakfast). I usually cut a loaf in halves, pop one half into a bread bag, wrap it up snugly, and into the freezer it goes! It‚Äôs worked really well for me (and definitely better than when I used to put my bread in a plastic container) because ‚Äì I think ‚Äì any water vapour from the bread is not trapped in a container, causing freezer burn, where ice üßä forms on the bread. It‚Äôs also easy to go from bakery to freezer and I don‚Äôt need to bother keep using the single-use paper or plastic bags that they hand out. And freezing bread is my fave way of making sure I don‚Äôt waste it.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My friend Joy made this loaf of sourdough for me. Thank you @joylai üòãüòãüòã we had it with dinner tonight as an accompaniment to a simple stew, to look up the gravy.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. This bag is heading over to @chewy.sourdough üíõüíõüíõ I love sourdough! They‚Äôre best straight from the oven but if you do freeze, I reheat them in the oven and it‚Äôs the next best thing!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #foodbag #breadbag #baguettebag #zerowaste #zerowasteliving #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowastemovement #zerowastelife #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastesnacking #zerowasteonthego #reusable #reusables #reducewaste #consciouschoices #shoplocal #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplatic #saynotodisposables #flatlay #zerowasteinspo #zerowastetravel #zerowastetravelhack #singaporeexpats #sgexpats #expatsg #expatsingapore #singaporeexpatwives #sgmom

*Sunday pre-dinner snack, anyone?*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. It‚Äôs not quite dinner time for me yet; cooking generally begins only after the sun has dry because the sun streams into the kitchen starting round 4 and I just can‚Äôt.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My stomach is asking for a snack and I wish I had some Old Chang Kee curry puff. A Krispy Kreme donut üç© would be nice too but all I have are donut plushies!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. This is my take on a Studio Ghibli inspired snack baggie! When @meiangiez said she liked Studio Ghibli, I thought of this print immediately; and this was her choice too! This print also reminded both of us of the Nintendo raving rabbits! Argh how cute!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I personally pick each fabric that is in my collection and I buy small quantities ‚Äì typically 1 to 3 yards; sometimes when I‚Äôbe used up my fabric, I can‚Äôt get more of the same so if you spot a fabric that you like, DM me about it quick!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Hope you‚Äôve all had lovely weekends and are enjoying what‚Äôs left of the Sunday. *Pretty things that bring a smile*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I spend a lot of time in my kitchen, it is really the heart of my home. For those of you who don‚Äôt know me, I love cooking and baking and have a weakness for cookbooks, which I‚Äôm trying to keep in control, I love tea as much as I love coffee, and I love having family and friends over for tea or a meal.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. So it‚Äôs not surprising that I love pretty things in my kitchen. My kitchen is a mix of Ikea staples (my everyday dinner plates are white 90-cent plates that I bought more than 15 years ago when I was still living with my parents), Daiso impulse buys (I very soon realised that if I bought individual pieces from Daiso, it would still be a big chunk of change), investment pieces (I love enamelled cast iron cookware), and mismatched vintage in the form of teacups and saucers that I pick up on travels.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. If I make tea in a teapot, I love drinking it out of little pretty teacups; it‚Äôs a me-moment of stillness. Be prepared for the inevitable kitchen spills and quick clean up with some unpaper towels in pretty prints that also bring smiles (because, as I think we can all agree, kitchen clean up isn‚Äôt necessarily on our priority list of things to do).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. *Keeping healthy and hygienic habits is more important than ever*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I keep an unpaper towel near the sink to wipe up any water from using the tap that inevitably splashes on the counter, condensation from cold things, accidental spills (thankfully if anything, my spills are just water and not anything sugary as I don‚Äôt have sweet drinks at home), etc. I wipe as I go and do a thorough clean once a week.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My counter top is kept dry so my unpaper towels usually are only slightly damp when I use them; I just lay it across my faucet to dry in-between uses. If it gets thoroughly wet (for example if I have to put in effort to wring the water out), that‚Äôs my cue to hang it outside where there‚Äôs better ventilation and moving air, then transfer to the dirty laundry pile once it‚Äôs dry, and take out a new unpaper towel. I hardly wash anything by hand because I don‚Äôt think I (personally) can agitate it as well as a washing machine.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I find that if i keep my cloths dry in between uses, I keep mildew formation at bay. My mother operates on a wet towel protocol and I really dislike touching wet cloths (bacteria multiplies faster in warm, damp environments and transfers most via liquids).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. With this 2019 Novel Coronavirus, wash you‚Äôre hands often, wipe down your screens regularly (I put a tiny drop of hand soap on the screen or dollop some suds from washing my hands on the screen and then wipe down), and change out your towels and wipes often. And on the body front, fruit and veg for fresh vitamins and water to hydrate.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #unpapertowel #unpapertowels #clothwipes #reusablecloth #reusablewipes #reusablecloths #reusables #reusable #cloth #cloths #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastejourney zerowastelife #zerowastekitchen #zerowasteswaps #zerowasteinspo #zerowastehacks . #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reducingwaste #flaylay #singaporeexpats #sgexpats #expatsg #expatsingapore #singaporeexpatwives #sgmom

*System change, not climate change üôèüíîüåè*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. So I was in Charleston walking around, happy that I was using my reusable cup, proudly carrying it from my coffee cup! People commented on the cup and strap, and noticed  we used our own stainless steel containers and bamboo cutlery at breakfast. Don‚Äôt get me wrong , it‚Äôs great and I will continue using reusables wherever I can. But it‚Äôs not enough.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Today I went to on an old cotton plantation tour; a plantation that flourished on the backs of enslaved people. People were exploited for the production of xxx (name your crop). And our guide today said ‚Äì I paraphrase, ‚ÄúLook at the clothes your wearing, think about how you got here, even your phones... do you think that anything could be free from the exploitation or some resource?‚Äù. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. That was hard. I mean... unless I live completely off the grid, farm permaculture... How do I leave a carbon neutral footprint? I‚Äôve always been fascinated by what I know now is macro economics; I wish I had done more studies in this field.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. @gretathunberg said we need system change, and I wish I had a brain big enough to see an answer. But for now I‚Äôll try. I‚Äôll try to minimise my single-use, I‚Äôll try to not impulse buy things, I‚Äôll try to help wherever I can (workshop soon for Australia‚Äôs affected animals, please support!), and I‚Äôll try to be more grateful for all the privileges I‚Äôve been afforded üíõ Thank you for being on this journey with me.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Btw, the 2nd pic shows how I store my cup and strap ü§ó. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #bringyourown #reusables #reusablecoffeecup #coffee #keepcup #reusablecup #coffeecupstrap #coffeecupcarrier #coffeecupholder #zerowastecoffee #zerowasteonthego #zerowaste #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reusable #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #zerowasteshop #consciouschoices #butfirstcoffee #zerowastemaker #coffeecupholder #eco #coffeetogo @stojo #stojo #tinkerboxinthewild #systemchangenotclimatechange  #systemchange

*Choosing sustainability is a privilege*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I know I‚Äôm privileged ‚Äì as I type this, I‚Äôm on a clean bed in Wilmington, North Carolina on vacation to visit family and friends; I‚Äôve a pretty nice smart phone that lets me take and edit great pictures, WiFi and data, and headspace to plan what I can do (financially and in service) to help with the Australian bushfire crisis. This is privilege.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Privilege means having the resources to invest in something upfront for the future; we don‚Äôt even have to think about it, it‚Äôs given.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I was first acquainted with the idea of privilege when I read a case study about how people buy laundry detergent in sachets, which work out to be waaaay more expensive than buying a box or bottle. The big manufacturers make more money per unit from those little sachets than they do a big bottle üò°üò§. People with limited income need this and can‚Äôt afford to go without for the length of time needed to save up it. I know another family who (back then) had rented their TV at ¬£50/month for years; I couldn‚Äôt understand why they didn‚Äôt just buy a TV for ¬£250 but I guess present need was prioritised.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Having a reusable coffee cup is a privilege; that my home has four is privilege. You reading this is privilege. I‚Äôm trying not to take what I have for granted even though there will always be others who have more. If hadn‚Äôt been born into a life with some privilege, I wouldn‚Äôt be in a position to make a difference.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Choose wisely. Reuse as much as you can. Be bold. Be kind. Help wherever possible ü•∞. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #bringyourown #reusables #reusablecoffeecup #coffee #keepcup #reusablecup #coffeecupstrap #coffeecupcarrier #coffeecupholder #zerowastecoffee #zerowasteonthego #zerowaste #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reusable #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #zerowasteshop #igsg #consciouschoices #butfirstcoffee #zerowastemaker #coffeecupholder #eco #coffeetogo @stojo #stojo @keepcup #systemchangenotclimatechange #shopeco

*Volcano mocha ‚Äì mocha with chilli üå∂ ‚Äì on a cold winter‚Äôs day*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Far from having done any statistically significant research, the coffee scene in Philly brings some interesting flavour profiles that I haven‚Äôt seen (much of or at all) in other cities. My favourites are raspberry mocha and chilli üå∂ mocha üëåüëçüòã. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. We went to the Italian Market yesterday and a must-visit whenever I‚Äôm there is @fantes9thstreet, a cook shop that sells baking and cooking periphernalia. I spent 30 seconds in the coffee section before realising they had a little coffee shop section with a barista and proper coffee ü§ó It was freezing so I got the Volcano ‚Äì a mocha with chilli üå∂. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I got my @stojo out and struck up a conversation with the barista about why I bring my own. Maybe people aren‚Äôt aware yet and putting coffee in my reusable coffee cup is moving the needle of awareness along that little bit. I‚Äôve also started conversations with friends and family through buying food from the market in my food container, snacks (in my snack baggie), and washing my bamboo cutlery after use (and them bring curious about my cutlery pouch).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. [Low waste bathroom: Part 1] .. . The bathroom was the first place we made numerous swaps for sustainable alternatives when we started our journey towards creating less waste in our home. It was easier and less stressful. .. . We also designed the bathroom to make it easier for our kids to independently reach their shower essentials including the position of the shower head. .. . From left to right are: a soap bag from @thesustainabilityproject_ to store bits of soap and use it every week to exfoliate; feminine wash (only thing in plastic but I don‚Äôt mind! I‚Äôm going to use the same bottle for refills soon!); refillable shampoo and conditioner from @unpackt.sg ; my absolute favourite shampoo and conditioner bar from @solidskincareco (I‚Äôve tried about 6-7 brands but this is the best in my opinion! More on that in a separate post); soap bars from @soapammasoaps (I also have other palm-oil free ones from @scoopwholefoods_sg) and. .. . The best part about using soap bars vs their liquid counterparts is that they last for longer, are package free (mostly!) and don‚Äôt have much carbon emissions when being shipped to the store when compared to large bottles of liquid solutions. .. . A good tip to keeping your soap bars from dying out soon is to use soap dishes with good drainage and ensuring they‚Äôre dry after use.

*Plants in the ocean, the jungle, and the dessert*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. The resurgence of plant popularity is quite nice, the idea of building an oasis in the city; it‚Äôs on trend. Plants are nice though ‚Äì they positively affect mood and mental health, and (on however small a scale) take in carbon dioxide.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. These pads are going to @elizabelsy and @tropism, and when I put them together for a picture, it wasn‚Äôt just about how lovely they looked together, but a story of ecosystems ‚Äì the marine üê≥ ecosystem, the jungle üåøecosystem, and even the dessert üåµ ecosystem. In a working ecosystem, there are cycles and renewal ‚Äì a time to sow and a time to reap.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôve only ever lived in an urban setting and I‚Äôm tremendously grateful to the opportunities I‚Äôve had simply because I was born where I was. I don‚Äôt see urbanisation  though, as an ecosystem because I‚Äôm not putting back what I‚Äôm taking out. And that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve been learning ‚Äì we got where we did because we utilised resources; we exploited resourcesüè≠. The haves gain more, and the have-nots suffer. This is the economics I didn‚Äôt understand in school.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Moving forward, I‚Äôm looking into how I can give back. I don‚Äôt know how yet. I think I want to plant trees, so I‚Äôm researching that. Have you done research or know if any programmes? If you do, please leave me a comment/DM. I‚Äôd love to know more.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #reusablepads #reusables #clothpads #pads #rumps #reusablepantyliners #pantyliner #reusablemenstrualproducts #pad #ecofriendlypads #zerowasteliving #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowastemovement #zerowastelife #zerowasteperiods #zerowasteperiod #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastejourney #reusable #consciouschoices #saynotosingleuse #flatlay #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #happyperiod #happyperiods #zerowasteinspo #mondayblues #marineconservation

The conversations we have about dogs üòÖ She decided to get more unpaper towel minis for herself and Rex!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Many of you love my dino prints and and Macy initially selected 2 of them for Rex. I suggested a third and she thought it was a great idea to differentiate hers from his. He gets ü¶ï because .. Rex. T-Rex ü¶ñ. How cute is that? In my opinion, another great example of fabric design that says something about the recipient.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Macy also brought up the issue of mould which I‚Äôll address here. Because Singapore‚Äôs weather is so humid, try to hang your unpaper towels to dry in a well ventilated space. Moving air is preferable to direct sunlight in an area against a wall or closed window; if the air surrounding the item is saturated with water molecules, drying will be more laborious and mould may still develop. A washing machine‚Äòs spin cycle will wring out more water than what you can get with your hands so that‚Äôs something to note as well.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Hope this helps (I‚Äôve learnt from bad experience of hanging my bath towels in my bathroom which is incredibly humid)!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #unpapertowel #unpapertowels #clothwipes #reusablecloth #reusablewipes #unpapers #reusablecloths #reusables #reusable #cloth #cloths #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastejourney zerowastelife #zerowastekitchen #zerowasteswaps #zerowasteinspo #zerowastehacks #zerowastelifehacks #zerowastecloths. saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reducingwaste #zerowastegram #flaylay #montessori #childfriendly #preparedenvironment

*Watermelon in a snack baggie?*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôve been watching documentaries on Netflix while sewing and today‚Äôs theme is food ‚Äì the science of, what‚Äôs good for you, the benefits of a plant-based diet. I wanted something sweet and cold and was thinking of ice cream üç® but decided on watermelon üçâ instead. After all, it was cut and ready to go.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Eating fruit is a great idea! It is a whole food, unprocessed and unadulterated (ice cream is totally a processed food üòÇ). My cousin bought a whole watermelon for $7, cut it up herself and split it among 3 households!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Whether you bring your own from home or get some from the fruit seller when you‚Äôre out, have you thought of using a snack baggie instead of those single use plastic bags that will probably never get a second use? My snack baggies are a pretty cotton exterior with a certified food safe lining that‚Äôs greaseproof and waterproof. It‚Äôs not meant for liquids like soup, as there are seams in the pouch, but a little liquid from fruit (yes, even watermelon) will be sufficiently contained. I avoid sharp objects like skewers that might puncture the lining so one of your reusables (like my bamboo fork from @bamboostrawgirl) will be perfect. Where you‚Äôre done, just flip the pouch inside out and wash the lining that‚Äôs come into contact with the food with a little dish soap, and dry open. It usually dries in under an hour.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. *When will we reach the critical mass tipping point on climate change where we‚Äôre not the minority anymore?*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ‚ÄúSystem change not climate change,‚Äù that‚Äôs what @gretathunberg is call for. It‚Äôs not about the reusable straw or the reusable pad. And yet it is about the reusable straw and the reusable pad.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Individual effort seems small. It *is* small compared to what large corporations can do. But when many individuals start doing something differently, it become a collective voice, and the stronger that voice, the more governments and corporations will need to listen and change. (I‚Äôve added a link to an article that explains the sigmoid curve of system change. It‚Äôs in the linktree in my bio.). ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. We might be the minority but we‚Äôre most definitely not alone! üê•üê•üê•ü¶¢üê•. In the meantime, if you switched out disposable pads for reusables, you‚Äôd save 216 pads a year from being incinerated (toxic fumes) and ultimately going to landfill (space limitations, toxic substances leaching into the ground and water systems). How‚Äôs that for making a difference?. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. This pad and liner are headed to @jinglebellyee soon and I‚Äôm excited. Thank you for choosing The Tinkerbox and I‚Äôm so happy to be on this journey with you!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #pantyliner #pantyliners #reusablepantyliners #liners #clothpantyliner #clothpad #reusablepad #reusablepads #reusablemenstrualproducts #rumps #reusable #reusables #climatechangeactions #reusableperiodproducts #zerowaste #zerowasteperiod #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #journeytozerowaste #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #flatlay #consciouschoices #rubberduckie #rubberduckies #systemchangenotclimatechange

*Almond mylk in my coffee ‚òïÔ∏è today at The Conscious Festival. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôve been thinking about switching from milk to mylk (Urban Dictionary: an alternatively spelled word used to describe plant derived 'milks‚Äù). But not thinking about things differently won‚Äôt get us out of the hole we‚Äôve dug ourselves into.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. *Just one please*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. So often, society tells us subtly that one (or enough) isn‚Äôt enough and we need more ‚Äì to make it worthwhile, that more is good. The message comes through when people say ‚Äújust‚Äù one for a seat in a restaurant (have you ever heart ‚Äújust two‚Äù?), how loose sweet potatoes at @littlefarms costs $1 more per kilo than plastic prepacked, ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Too often, I‚Äôve bought things in multi buy packs that have just gone to waste because I can‚Äôt finish them in time.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. This is my favourite egg tart ‚Äì @taicheongsg. I have been guilty of buying multiple egg tarts and not eating them quickly enough that the crust gets damp, and the custard shrivels and oozes liquid ‚Äì compare that with fresh out of the oven. I‚Äôve saved many an egg tart by air-frying them but I‚Äôve also thrown a few away ‚Äì it‚Äôs throwing ~$2 away per egg tart and it‚Äôs food waste.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. The other thing that bugs me about #TaiCheongsg is when I see the staff carefully box up 4 egg tarts in a well constructed box that hasn‚Äôt any other use, and customers who demand multiple plastic bags (that are shaped specially for the box and made from nice thick plastic but has little secondary use); my heart hurts.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I felt like an egg tart today and so I got one in my snack baggie; they would have put one egg tart in one paper (I think) bag otherwise.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I would like to see enough as being a good thing. Table for one. One (or enough) egg tart(s) for now ü§óüëçüëÜ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #snackbag #snackbaggie #reusablebag #reusablesnackbag #reusablefoodbag #reusablesandwichbag #foodbag #sandwichbag #reusable #reusables #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteonthego #zerowasteinspo #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastefood #zerowasteonthego #breadwithoutbags #byob #bringyourown #bringyourownbag #zerowastezakka #taicheongeggtarts #tinkerboxinthewild #friyay

It definitely didn‚Äôt sew well at a quality that I was happy with, a quality that you guys know to expect from me. It was a nightmare.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. *Snack baggie FAQ*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Many of you guys in the community already know about snack baggies but for those who haven‚Äôt heard about it, here‚Äôs a little FAQ!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Q: Can I put greasy/hot food inside?. A: My snack baggies are lined with a certified food safe, greaseproof and waterproof liner. You can put foods with high water content (like fruit), or hot greasy foods (like a baked sweet potato) in it easily. It‚Äôs not meant for liquids so don‚Äôt use this with soup!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Q: How do I wash it? Is this machine washable?. A: Simply turn inside out and hand wash with a little dish soap, and air dry. Your snack baggie will be ready for use again in under an hour. Machine washable too, just put it in a washing bag and set your machine to a cold wash. Do not tumble dry. Do not use fabric softener as this will weaken the fabric. As for how often, that‚Äôs entirely up to you!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Q: Do three little buttons hold? Do crumbs fall out given the snack baggie gets tossed around in your bag?. A: For most snacks, including nuts, the pieces are big enough that they wont tend to fall out, even inside your bag.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Q: How big is one?. A: The snack measures about 17x17 cm square. It‚Äôs sized for a nice fat sandwich, and will fit a bagel, 1‚Äì2 donuts, a croissant, or a pain au chocolat. It mesnt to hold enough for person and is not family sized.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Got another question, let me know in the comments below!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Pictured: Strawberry üçì print snack baggie that‚Äôs going to @lyn_gm2 tomorrow! I can‚Äôt wait üòäü§óüòã. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #snackbag #snackbags #reusablesandwichbags #foodbag #reusablesnackbag #reusablesnackbags #zerowaste #zerowasteliving #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowastemovement #zerowastelife #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastesnacking #zerowasteonthego #reusable #reusables #reducewaste #consciouschoices #shoplocal #artisan #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplatic #saynotodisposables #flatlay #zerowasteinspo #strawberry #strawberryfabric #zerowastetravel #zerowastetravelhack

*Reusables really spark joy more so than single-use*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. With the exception of one party that I hosted ‚Äì my housewarming party, four years ago ‚Äì I‚Äôve never had company over and served food with single use because I think food and drink is enjoyed more eaten with ‚Äúproper‚Äù plates, glasses, cutlery, serving dishes, etc. I enjoy the food more having the right implements, sitting down wherever possible, and enjoying conversation and company.  For me that‚Äôs being present in the moment. There‚Äôs more to wash after but meals are more enjoyable üíõ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. It‚Äôs different at hawkers. The concept of a hawker is affordable, fast and convenient. Does it matter then? Before I started my zero waste journey, I used to get take out from hawkers in single-use (that was normal I guess) and decant my food into proper plates and use the office cutlery. I realised that I don‚Äôt enjoy eating from disposable containers üò©. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. @etlchezzabelle got a coffee cup strap, cutlery pouch and snack baggie customised in the Japanese wave print fabric ‚Äì this wave üåä print looks really nice and it might even be the next navy Asanoha!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôm so encouraged to see an increased acceptance of BYO and people feeling proud to be ditching the disposables. Cheryl, I hope these bring you lots of joy and serve you well on your exciting new adventure ‚úàÔ∏è. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. If you are considering getting a #stojo that goes with this print, the Carbon grey and Denim blue would look awesome with it (@eco_le_sg stock them so go check them out). For me, it looks pretty fab with my grey @Keepcup ü§óüíõüòÅ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #snackbag #snackbaggie #reusablebag #reusablesnackbag #reusablefoodbag #reusablesandwichbag #reusablecoffeecup #coffeecupstrap #coffeetogo #coffeeonthego #zerowastecoffee #cutlerypouch #pouch #reusablepouch #reusablecutlery #reusable #reusables #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteonthego #zerowasteinspo #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastelifestyle #flatlay #japanesewaves

*More unpaper towels*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I often get asked ‚ÄúWhy are unpaper towels needed anyway?‚Äù I couldn‚Äôt really trace the etymology of this term but here‚Äôs my hypothesis.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. In most homes that I‚Äôve been to in the US, kitchens are stocked exclusively with paper towels. Kitchen roll is used for wiping up tables after every meal, to blot moisture off meat (this I understand), as a barrier/separator so pots and pans don‚Äôt scratch each other when stored. Most US homes are dish washer enabled so hardly anything is hand washed and the next day when dishes come out, they don‚Äôt need further towel-drying.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. The US paper towel market leader ‚Äì Bounty ‚Äì is also a really good product (compared to typical stuff available in Singapore), and the whole category has done a great job marketing the convenience and hygiene of single-use. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. The next time you reach for that single use paper towel, have a think about whether you can find a reusable alternative!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #unpapertowel #unpaper #unpapertowels #clothwipes #reusablecloth #reusablewipes #unpapers #reusablecloths #reusables #reusable #cloth #cloths #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastejourney zerowastelife #zerowastekitchen #zerowasteswaps #zerowasteinspo #zerowastehacks #zerowastelifehacks #zerowastecloths. saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reducingwaste #zerowastegram #flaylay #cleankitchen #reusablekitchenwipes

*Every home needs unpaper towels*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. When I first showed my unpaper towels to my dad he called them ‚Äúrags‚Äù but in my head, rags are... ratty and tattered. I looked the word up and the Oxford Dictionary says that rags are old cloths, typically torn from a larger piece. I wouldn‚Äôt consider unpaper towels and rags one and the same, though the difference is arguably small; I‚Äôd use a clean rag on a kitchen surface but I wouldn‚Äôt use an unpaper towel to wipe my hands dirty from motor oil.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôve been thinking about how paper towel is used to absorb the excess oil from fried food (my mom makes the best fried wontons üòã). ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. If you wanted to use an unpaper towel for excess oil absorption I‚Äôd recommend:. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ‚Ä¢ for not-so-oily foods a wire mesh tray (think tempura or katsu I‚Äôm good Japanese restaurants). ‚Ä¢ a few unpaper towels dedicated to food, preferably in darker shades with more robust patterns. Use the terry side as the oil will show up less obviously.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. And for those of you who have an one, fried wontons are a cinch to make in an air fryer. I fold my wontons into a triangle for max surface area crisping; don‚Äôt be tempted to wet the skin with water ‚Äì excess water will turn into steam and you‚Äôll end up with soggy wontons. Air fried wontons aren‚Äôt as crisp as their oil fried counterpart but in my opinion, they‚Äôre ~80% as good and well worth the 20% sacrifice. Less oil and less cleaning up are a definite win in my book.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. These unpaper towels are on their way to @gracetsanggg. I hope you find lots of joy in using them üíõüíõüíõ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #unpapertowel #unpapertowels #clothwipes #reusablecloth #reusablewipes #unpapers #reusablecloths #reusables #reusable #cloth #cloths #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastejourney zerowastelife #zerowastekitchen #zerowasteswaps #zerowasteinspo #zerowastehacks #zerowastelifehacks #zerowastecloths. saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reducingwaste #zerowastegram #flaylay #cleankitchen #reusablekitchenwipes #donuts

*Keeping food waste to a minimum*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I love making new dishes from ‚Äúfridge food‚Äù so that I don‚Äôt waste food. My veggie staples are broccoli, cauliflower, celery, carrot, bell pepper, and cabbage because these veggies last in the fridge, especially now that I‚Äôve discovered they last longer stored in my salad bag (that I bought but honestly it‚Äôs just a terry cloth bag ü§£ü§£ü§£ but it *does* work wonders and cabbage lasts 3 weeks).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Here‚Äôs some penne (from @eco_le_sg) with leftover stuff ‚Äì shmeiji mushrooms, celery, sausage ‚Äì in a tomato sauce. I find the tomatoes in Singapore lacking punch so I prefer to use pasata when making tomato-based pastas; I find that a little goes a long way. I wasn‚Äôt too hungry at dinner so the leftovers were out aside for lunch the next day. Leftovers are great because ‚Äî> less food waste and fewer dishes to wash (I hate doing dishes).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Had my lunch with some sparkling water with lemon. I have a @sodastreamsingapore because I love sparkling water and I didn‚Äôt want to buy multiple small plastic bottles of it (with sparkling water, it loses its sparkle if you don‚Äôt consume it quickly enough so getting a large bottle doesn‚Äôt work). Lovely on a crazy hot day.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Some unpaper towel minis ‚Äì unpaper towels are kitchen essentials for spills and drips and all that gooey, mucky kitchen stuff. The black on white dashed line print is playfully sophisticated and perfect for @3mm.montessori‚Äôs brand and the minis are great for small hands. These were commissioned by Jasmine for her coaching clients! Please check her out for accessible Montessori how-tos!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #unpapertowels #unpapers #unpapertowel #miniunpapertowels #reusablecloths #reusablewipes #reusables #reusable #cloth #cloths #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastejourney #zerowastelife #zerowastekitchen #zerowasteswaps #zerowasteinspo #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reducepapertoweluse #reducingwaste #prettyunpapertowels #flatlay #igsg #zerowastegram

*Living your (my) best life*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. So, this post has been one of the hardest to craft, because to me, this rainbow liner says so much about so much. And yet it‚Äôs just a pantyliner in a rainbow üåà print that probably no one will ever see you wearing.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. So instead of trying to untangle the mess of thoughts in my head, I‚Äôd like to say that I never thought I‚Äôd love sewing as much as I do (when I was a kid and had to sew in school, my mother took my project to a seamstress and asked her to make a few mistakes so that ‚Äúit looks like my daughter made this‚Äù). Yet here I am with handmade reusable alternative solutions to single-use problems.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. And in this, I find my purpose üíõüíõüíõ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. @ceeteeee ordered this liner and I‚Äôm so excited because I love her enthusiasm and her conviction, and I think this liner is so very her.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Happy weekend everyone and I hope you‚Äôre all living colourfully, even if your favourite colours are black and white! üíõ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #rainbow #rainbowpantyliner #pantyliner #pantyliners #reusablepantyliner #reusablepantyliners #reusablepads #reusablemenstrualproducts #tumps #livecolorfully #livecolourfully #reusable #reusables #reusablealternatives #saynotosingleuse #zerowaste #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowasteinspo #flatlay #climatechangeisreal #livingmybestlife #sustainable #everylittlecounts #makingadifference #makermovement #maker #makersgonnamake #katespadelivecolorfully #katespadequote

*Do these look like dried apricots üçë to you?*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I was in Uzbekistan a year ago; my partner by himself about 6 months ago and to Kyrgyzstan more recently. I‚Äôm not a big fan of dried fruit but we did get some when we were there. These browny fruit with pits were were in the ‚Äúpoint to pick‚Äù fruit haul and we didn‚Äôt really know what they were ‚Äì we just pointed! Turns out, they‚Äôre dried apricots!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Even though I‚Äôm not a fan, I recognised dried apricots as flat, bright orange circles, so we postulated that these might be peaches. We finally found out that they were apricots in Kyrgyzstan, along with the why that I hadn‚Äôt known about dried fruit.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. The bright orange hue of dried apricots comes from sulphur dioxide which is a preservative. It preserves colour as well as fruit. A quick search says that light (coloured) dried fruit is provably preserved with SO2, such as golden raisins.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôm not equipped with the science behind whether SO2 is safe (it seems safe for most, with the exception of people with respiratory ailments like asthma). I did read on a bulletin that people in the dried fruit business prefer the non-sulphite method of drying fruit for taste though it‚Äôs more expensive. If you know, write about it, I‚Äôd be interested to find out.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Brand new pattern: remember my blue monsteras? They brought in a green version. I wonder if I played a part because I kept urging him to source for it. Snack baggies are great for dried fruit (and nuts) if you like em! Or a whole other host of yummies to. Be creative!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #donut #donuts #snackbag #snackbags #reusablesandwichbags #foodbag #reusablesnackbag #reusablesnackbags #zerowaste #zerowasteliving #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowastemovement #zerowastelife #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastesnacking #zerowasteonthego #reusable #reusables #reducewaste #consciouschoices #shoplocal #artisan #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplatic #saynotodisposables #saynotoplasticbags #flatlay #zerowasteinspo #driedapricots

*Hot! ‚òÄÔ∏èüî•*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. The romantic way of looking at #endlesssummer is summer holidays, beaches, long daylight hours, cocktails with umbrellas in them üçπ, and paradise. And in Singapore, the heat üî• and humidity üí¶.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. To mitigate this, I started being more conscious of the material(s) my clothes were made from, prioritising natural over synthetic. Cottons I knew, and I grew fond of linen, a fabric I had previously reserved for explorer types (think Indiana Jones‚Äô sidekick).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Cotton and linen are lovely, natural fibres that, when made into clothes, allow skin to breathe and perspiration to evaporate. This improves the comfort quotient of your clothes. Why shouldn‚Äôt liners be breathable too?. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My pads and liners are made of different types of cotton fabric. The liner is exclusively woven cotton, and the pad is deliberately layered with different weaves of cotton to maximise speed of absorption and quantity absorbed.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Natural fabrics frees me to feel more comfortable throughout the day, and pretty prints make me happy. If you‚Äôre in the tropics, enjoy the endless summer üèñ and bring a handheld fan with you for too-hot days. It‚Äôs incredibly more effective than using a piece of paper to fan yourself!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #reusablepantyliners #reusablepads #reusables #clothpads #pads #prettypads #rumps #pad #yellow #ecofriendlypads #zerowasteliving #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowastemovement #zerowastelife #zerowastelifestyle #zerowasteperiod #zerlwasteinspo #happyperiods #reusable #consciouschoices #shopsg #saynotosingleuse  #saynotodisposables #ecofriendly #flatlay #pineappleprints #prettypantyliners #prettypads

*Sometimes 30 cents is worth more than a dollar*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. The guys at @nyloncoffee are absolutely lovely, and one of their team recognised me when I went back in the afternoon for my second cup! (We had dropped @nanalovesapples off for dental work in the morning and were picking her up in the afternoon).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Nylon is another coffee shop that encourage #byo. They give you 30 cents off for bringing your own cup in, but are always happy to serve it in one of their cups of you‚Äôre drinking it there.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. For me, it‚Äôs not the dollar value of the discount that attests to your sustainability intentions, and I‚Äôm happier with Nylon‚Äôs 30 cents than I am with @coffeebeansg‚Äôs $1. Why‚Äôs that?. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I recently ordered a drink from the Coffee Bean and the cashier assured me that I can get my drink in a reusable cup. It sounded like a good plan, so I said yes. When I looked into the kitchen, I saw their staff making my drink in a single-use plastic cup and I exclaimed. They heard me and said that they needed to, in order to measure the ingredients out ü§î. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. To me, this was an example a large organisation not having a central and overarching sustainability policy. My theory: Operations continued to use single-use with the discount taken from Corporate Social Responsibility‚Äôs budget. To me, it seems like a lack of education, incentive and process for Coffee Bean  as a whole to be more sustainable in light of today‚Äôs plastic single-use crisis.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Nylon, I‚Äôll be back next week for Nana‚Äôs follow up! Thank you for the lovely conversation and the good coffee.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #bringyourown #reusables #reusablecoffeecup #coffee #keepcup #reusablecup #coffeecupstrap #coffeecupcarrier #coffeecupholder #zerowastecoffee #zerowasteonthego #zerowaste #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reusable #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #tinkerboxinthewild #zerowasteshop #igsg #consciouschoices #designthinking #climatechangesolutions #butfirstcoffee #zerowastemaker #maker

*Happy Friyay, happy period*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Yay it‚Äôs the weekend! Do you look forward to weeeknds? Even though as a small business owner, I work practically every day, I look forward to my weekends as much as I look forward to working ‚Äì measuring, drawing, cutting, sewing, and chatting with you guys! Making reusable alternatives for you guys gives me purpose and makes me extremely happy. Thank you for liking my work! üôè. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. But why do I say happy period? Periods are usually a dreaded week in every woman‚Äôs life, and there are good reasons. Hormones make you tired, or greedy or grouchy or all of the above. For me, it‚Äôs the sticky feeling that I hate, needing to think about changing pads, and cramps!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Reduced toxins from single-use pads or tampons (with way too much plastic in them) have helped me personally with the reduction of Nabothian cysts (my gynaecologist was pleased). And though I can‚Äôt get away from changing pads, the pretty, prints make a difference ü§óü§óü§ó My favourite prints make me smile and bring lots of joy! ü§óüíõ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Pictured, some pads that went out to @thewanderingsigns and @mishiscripts. I hope they make your periods happier periods üòçü§óüíõ Happy weekend everyone ü•∞. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #reusablepads #reusables #clothpads #pads #rumps #reusablemenstrualproducts #pad #ecofriendlypads #zerowasteliving #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowastemovement #zerowastelife #zerowasteperiods #zerowasteperiod #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastejourney #reusable #consciouschoices #saynotosingleuse #flatlay #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #happyperiod #happyperiods #watermelonprints #catprints #zerowasteinspo #happyfriyay #weekendvibes

*Keepcup/Stojo*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I wish the Unicode Consortium would update their coffee-moji (add a reusable cup?) ‚Äì I‚Äôd use it *all the time*!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Coffee in cities is so ubiquitous; the disposable coffee cup had become a status symbol, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm busy being fabulous, far too busy to sit down for coffee so I‚Äôll get mine to go‚Äù.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Brits drink more than 8m takeout coffees a day. 25b cups are thrown away in the US. @Starbucks US still (I witnessed this in  January 2019) had recycling bins for cups but expos√©es have shown that they just get sent to landfill.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. If you‚Äôre drinking anything in a disposable coffee cup (or in Asia a plastic bag), please get a reusable coffee cup! Many of you will have your own - yay! if you‚Äôre still on the fence, I recommend @keepcup (my preferred) and @stojo.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Keepcup pros: replaceable/ interchangeable parts, limited wear and tear, choice of glass or plastic cup.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Keepcup cons: not leak proof, glass weighs more, takes up more space, plastic shows tea stains, some garish colours.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Stojo pros: collapses to take up less space, leak proof (no, don‚Äôt put a full cup of coffee into your bag, but it keeps coffee dregs inside after you finish), much better choice of colours.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Stojo cons: Mechanical wear and tear of the silicone from repeated collapsing, propensity for silicone to absorb smells, discolouration (less obvious on darker models), top heavy design more prone to topping, especially the Biggie.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I like these but whatever you choose, it‚Äôs a step in the right direction. And it‚Äôs nice when coffeeshops give you a discount!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #bringyourown #reusables #reusablecoffeecup #coffee #keepcup #reusablecup #coffeecupstrap #coffeecupcarrier #coffeecupholder #zerowastecoffee #zerowasteonthego #zerowaste #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reusable #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #tinkerboxinthewild #zerowasteshop #igsg #consciouschoices #designthinking #climatechangesolutions #butfirstcoffee #zerowastemaker #makermovemet #coffeecupholder #eco

*Happy weekend*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôm thankful that the haze is better today that it was yesterday. *A morning without rush*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. It‚Äôs been a really busy weekend but I‚Äôve finally Sunday to wake up to calm, no rushing around needing to walk @nanalovesapples, who‚Äôs staycationing at my parents‚Äô, or rushing to a one-hour bus journey.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Scrubbed my face with a face scrub from @rootsofjoyshop (mixed in an old  @awfullychocolatesg ramekin that was too good to discard with @oasisskin‚Äôs small spatula that I absolutely love).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Since working full time on the Tinkerbox, I haven‚Äôt had much need for makeup, and I‚Äôve been really happy about that because make up just slides off my skin. I‚Äôve switched to reusable facial cotton pads when I clean but my skincare routine is still alarmingly lacking.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôve heard it from the beauty blogging world that if skin is greasy, adding an oil to your skincare routine actually helps; surface dryness stimulates an over production of sebum which results in a greasy face. Yes, get that. Tried it. Hadn‚Äôt really worked. What I didn‚Äôt understand is different oils have different molecule sizes that work for different skin types! Aha moment. I‚Äôm happy to report that I‚Äôve been using Oasis Skin‚Äôs Instaglow (about 50% of the time) and am really happy with how it feels. Send them a DM or visit the shop because Hildra will explain things much better than I can.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My reusable facial cotton pads are made form remnant fabric from larger projects. I don‚Äôt usually make them specially but I do have them often. If I‚Äôm at a pop up (which I will be in Sep and Oct, details to follow), you can pick and choose or I‚Äôll send you a mixed prints if you place an order.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Have a happy Sunday! üíõ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowastejourney #zerowastebathroom #zerowastemovement #zerowastelife #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastehacks #zerowastealternatives #zerowastetravel #facialrounds #cottonfacepads #reusables #saynotosingleuse #stylemepretty #makermovement #flatlay #eco #zerowasteinspo #zakka #shopsg #sgmaker #makermovement #weekendvibes #weekend

*Cover and keep*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Finally made ‚Äúproper‚Äù dinner last night. I‚Äôm quite bad at feeding myself properly when It‚Äôs just dinner for one ‚Äì the effort for one portion or two is the same. And I hate doing dishes where my hands are in prolonged contact with dish washing liquid and water because I have dyshidrotic eczema ‚Äì tiny blisters form on my hands that itch crazily!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I looked at the two peppers üå∂ in my fridge last night trying to decide if one would do, but I love food that‚Äôs visually pleasing, so I decided to go for both colours. I knew I wouldn‚Äôt be able to finish all of it so I set aside half for tonight‚Äôs dinner, and here‚Äôs where bowl covers come in handy.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Bees wax wraps are really popular in place of cling wrap and I have some myself, but they‚Äôll need rewaxing over time, so I save that to wrap fruit and veg (like lemon because I never use up a whole lemon üçã at one go and they keep weeks wrapped in a beeswax wrap).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. These cotton bowl covers are useful for avoiding condensed liquid dripping back onto your food. A few weeks ago, I baked a cake in a loaf tin and was taking it across town. I didn‚Äôt want to end up with soggy cake, so I popped on one of my bowl covers over a cake loaf tin. Not only did it do the job, I was thrilled that the round cover was versatile enough to use on a rectangular tin.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. As for my salad, it‚Äôs Uzbek inspired (Uzbek salads üíõüíõüíõ). Mixed peppers, sliced thinly,. Drizzle with sesame oil. Salt and pepper to taste. (I‚Äôm not a fan of the typical honey mustard or balsamic dressings). Try this salad ü§óüëåüëç. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #reusables #reusable #reduce #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteliving #zerowastelife #zerowastemovement #zerowastejourney #zerowastelife #zerowastekitchen #zerowasteswaps #zerowasteinspo #saynotosingleuse #saynotoclingwrap #saynotoclingfilm #saynotodisposables #saynotofoodwaste #saynotosingleuseplastic #flatlay #bowlcover #bowlcovers #foodstorage #shopsg #shoplocal #conciouschoices #choosereusable #beeswaxwrap #salad

What‚Äôs in your bag?. . . This week, we asked staff at our headquarters to share with us what they have been doing to save the earth. It is not surprising to find them reducing the use of plastics. Let‚Äôs look at some of the things we found in their bags:. . . Pic 1: Bertrand has foldable shopping bags in his backpack. He has them for moments of last-minute grocery shopping. His water bottle is also in his bag. When thirsty, he would not need to buy packet drinks or bottled water.. . . Pic 2: Jorain brings her breakfast from home, packed in a reusable container. She also uses her own cutleries for she believes in using less plastic. She also carries a tote bag when going out for lunch so she does not need 5o take plastic bags after shopping. She can just place them into her tote bag.. . . Pic 3: Beatrice is well prepared as she has a lot of items in her bag. Metal straws, foldable shopping bag, two water bottles; one for water and the other for coffee/tea.. . . Pic 4: Lastly, Gail has everything reusable in her bag; her water bottle, reusable containers, and shopping bags. See how she also keeps her items in pouches!. . . We hope our little actions will inspire you to join us to care for our Common Home.. . . PS: No bags were ransacked during this activity.üòú #caritassingapore #caritassg #caritasasia #caritas #laudatosi #careforourcommonhome #whatsinyourbag #whatiscaritasdoing #lessplastics #reusables

*Three tips when making the switch*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Today has been extra fun! Lunch with a friend and checked out @oasisskin (met founder Hildra who‚Äôs wonderful üëã). I still have some bottled haircare (no SLS, but comes in plastic) but the best time to explore a new product is before you run out.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Pre-researching, being prepared, and phasing in is also my strategy for switching from single-use fem care (pantyliners, pads, tampons) to reusable.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Here are my three tips for an easy switch:. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. 1. Start on your last/lightest day:. Start on your lightest day, when you‚Äôre kind of just spotting, and work backwards to your heavier days. If you start on a light day, you can try a pantyliner before moving onto a pad for heavier days.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. 2. Phase your switch in:. Don‚Äôt think you need to get your complete set of reusable pads all at once. You might like different feels, fabrics and finishes (and there are different ones to choose from, for example I don‚Äôt like flannel especially in this weather but some love the feel of it).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. 3. Start at home:. It can be worrying wearing reusables out for the first time, so start your journey when you know you‚Äôre going to be relaxing at home. This way you‚Äôll be less stressed as you can go to the loo any time. Monitor your flow and get a feel for how long you want to go between changes. You might also be able to feel the difference between how a cloth pad absorbs and how a disposable absorbs.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. If you have questions please DM me; saying no to plastic pads is a passion and I‚Äôm happy to talk about it lots.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #pantyliner #pantyliners #reusablepantyliners #liners #clothpantyliner #clothpad #reusablepad #reusablemenstrualproducts #rumps #reusable #reusables #reusableperiodproducts #zerowaste #zerowasteperiod #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #journeytozerowaste #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #flatlay #consciouschoices #myfavouritethings #prettyperiods #happyperiod #suststainablealternatoves #noplanetb

Visited the Singapore night festival last night. Because of the night fest, Substation stayed opened till 11pm and I was able to catch he exhibition 'Rejects'. Featured in the 2nd photo is the installation from the very talented amigurumi artist @kllylmrck. Creative, pretty and sad - for me. Go check out the art pieces and see what feelings they draw out of you. Feel and breathe again. .. Regardless of the valuation of the times, the intrinsic value of any piece of art/effort is unmistakable, awaiting the seeing eye and the perceiving mind. .. Caught unprepared, I did not get any drinks and settled for a late dinner of a turkey burger in my Ofoodin bag. No disposables except for the paper the burger was already sat on. .. If you are checking out the night fest, remember to BYO and spread the message. We don't want disposables! Hope the organisers will consider REUSABLES. Help! We are in a climate emergency. .. #sustainable #reusables #nodisposables #supportlocal #zerowaste #zerowastesg #byo #nooneistoosmalltomakeadifference

I don‚Äôt believe that zero waste is about restriction or denying yourself. I don‚Äôt think it has to be hard either. *A üåà of pantyliners üíõüíõüíõ*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Pantyliners are one of the easiest things to switch from disposable to reusable. It‚Äôs low risk, easy to wash, and so much more comfy than single-use.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ‚Ä¢ Why low risk? ‚Ä¢. Liners are designed to be worn on your lightest days or daily. Because they‚Äôre not for heavier days, you won‚Äôt risk a stain on your butt anyway. Once you see how easy it is, switching things up for other days will be easier.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ‚Ä¢ Easy care ‚Ä¢. Sometimes there are stains. I‚Äôve noticed over time, the fabric yellows slightly, this is normal. What‚Äôs good about my liners and pads is that the inner side (that comes into context with your skin) is made from *unbleached* cotton so it is a light wheat, natural colour. This is very forgiving. I chose unbleached cotton as that‚Äôs kindest to your skin. They machine wash and dry just fine, but will probably last longer if you line dry. I double wash mine, first with bar soap in the shower, then in the with the rest of my laundry üß∫ .. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. *Soooo comfortable*. My gynaecologist gave me the thumbs up for replacing commercial disposable liners with an all-cotton fabric alternative. It makes sense. Moisture and heat are a lovely environment that encourages bacterial growth. Increased breathability means more comfort, and when you feel good you can take on the world! üí™. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. In week or a month, how many disposable liners you be sending ultimately to landfill? A reusable could last you 5-10 years with care.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. If you have a question, please feel free to DM me. I love fem care dialogue! üíõüåàü§ó. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #pantyliner #pantyliners #reusablepantyliners #liners #clothpantyliner #clothpad #reusablepad #reusablemenstrualproducts #rumps #reusable #reusables #climatechangeactions #reusableperiodproducts #zerowaste #zerowasteperiod #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #journeytozerowaste #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #flatlay #consciouschoices #myfavouritethings #prettyperiods #happyperiod

What do you know about your food? Do you know where it was grown or raised? Who harvested it and if that person was paid a fair wage? Or if part of a rainforest was demolished to make room for your beef, soy, coffee, cocoa or palm oil? ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. .. .. .. I‚Äôm sure you are aware of what is going on in the Amazon and it has been difficult for me to find the words to convey a positive, actionable message, but I‚Äôm going to try! ‚û°Ô∏è. .. .. .. First, I am not Brazilian and only know of the political climate based upon what I learn from foreign publications. That being said, what I know best is what I can do at home; I can voice my concern to my own government reps and demand that they take action (for ex. Macron is urging G7 members-üá®üá¶üá´üá∑üá©üá™üáÆüáπüáØüáµüá∫üá∏üá¨üáß-to put this issue at the top of the agenda). .. .. .. .. Other things I can do from home are: to make a donation (@rainforestalliance, @wwf @amazonwatch are a few), educate others and offer support in anyway I can. I also recently downloaded  @ecosia, a search engine that plants trees üå≥ .. .. .. .. .. Lastly, it‚Äôs important to try to reduce beef consumption, but also keep in mind that JBS has subsidiaries all over the US. They are a majority stakeholder in Pilgrim‚Äôs Pride, which is one of the country‚Äôs largest poultry providers, with customers such as WalMart, Costco, Publix and even (wait for it) public schools. NOW are you going to tell a kid getting free lunch that may have not eaten otherwise to ‚Äògo vegan?‚Äô No. Can you voice your concern to your local store or school board about switching providers or offering more plant based options? Yes. (I understand it‚Äôs a lot more complicated than that, but doing nothing also results in nothing). üó£.. .. .. .. Personally, I need to be more cognizant of products like coffee and cocoa and not just in Brazil, but in other parts of central and South America. ‚òïÔ∏è All of the information on JBS is public and what is exported to your country is available on the oec.world website. You can also contact a company for answers. If they can‚Äôt give them to you, stop buying their products (if you can). Ok, have a wonderful weekend and be sure to check out @polly.barks virtual summit! üíö

*Every little counts*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Some days, I go through the ‚ÄúIs what I‚Äôm doing even making a difference?‚Äù My mind wondered to the thought of whether I‚Äôll see a post apocalyptic future in my lifetime and that was a extremely uncomfortable thought.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I countered that thought with a more empowering one. I read Stephen Covey‚Äôs The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People a few years ago and remembered the circle of influence vs. the circle of concern (swipe üëà, if you want details, google ‚Äì note: lowercase g ‚Äì it on @ecosia).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Climate change and its effects ‚Äì that‚Äôs a big, looming concern and I, as an individual, can‚Äôt single-handedly change it. So it sits in my circle of concern. But if I break the mammoth problem into smaller bits, I‚Äôm able to move chunks into my circle of influence, and it‚Äôs here that I can effect change üí™. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I‚Äôm trying to get my parents to reduce their single-use take out containers and cutlery. Sometimes it feels like an uphill battle and they probably won‚Äôt be around to experience the climate catastrophe. I explain, I ask, I nag, I plead. But I can‚Äôt actually change their minds for them. But my own actions with them must make a difference, no matter how small. I‚Äôm moving what I can‚Äôt control into smaller chunks that I am able to influence. Even this post has a secondary target audience ‚Äì my parents follow me ü§ó. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Thank you @aeri.lynn for getting your snack baggie and Stojo strap from me. I know you‚Äôre exploring options for more of your journey to zero waste and I‚Äôm really excited to be part of it! üíõüôèüòç. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #snackbag #snackbaggie #reusablebag #reusablesnackbag #reusablefoodbag #reusablesandwichbag #foodbag #sandwichbag #reusable #reusables #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteonthego #zerowasteinspo #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastefood #flatlay #reusablecoffeecup #coffeecupstrap #coffeetogo #coffeeonthego #zerowastecoffee #tinkerboxinthewild

*But first coffee*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Coffee in the morning is my ritual, it doesn‚Äôt stimulate me or keep me awake. I just love good coffee.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. In previous working lives, I used to buy coffee in disposable cups every day. Coffee was my psychological defence against what lurked behind enemy lines. I started using my Keepcup for water because I didn‚Äôt want to use tiny styrofoam cups big enough for two gulps of water, and serendipitously discovered @starbuckssg gives a 50-cent discount for BYO, which means that every 10-12 cups gives me a free coffee. Who can argue with that?. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. While coffee isn‚Äôt heavy, holding up a coffee cup can be annoying ‚Äì if you have to walk a long distance (I walked 30 min every morning) or if you have other things to hold (and everyone has a zillion things to hold these days, with a multitude of tech in our bags and our lives on our phones). Not to mention an arsenal of #byo!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My coffee cup strap comes in handy to free up some hand real estate. They work with any cup that has a removable band such as the #Keepcup, @Stojo, #Solcups, @revolv.io, to name a few. They‚Äôll work with other silicone cups and bamboo fibre cups (though please avoid the bamboo fibre - formaldehyde from the binding resin leaches into drinks at temperatures above 70¬∞C). I might ask you to check the specific dimensions of your cup though I‚Äôve now got a pretty good handle (funny but no pun intended ü§£ü§£ü§£) on sizing.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Click on #tinkerboxinthewild to see how some other people are liking their coffee cup straps as well as other things. And if you have a strap from me, please tag me! üôèüôèüôè. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Enjoy your coffee or tea, and have a great day! ü§óüëãüí™. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #bringyourown #bringyourowncup #bringyourownbag #bringyourowncoffeecup #byo #reuse #reusable #reusables #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #reusablecoffeecup #reusablecup #coffeecupstrap #coffeecupholder #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowastecoffee #zerowasteonthego #zerowasteinspo #zakka #keepcup #stojobiggie #consciouschoice

*My favourite things‚Äù. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Raindrops on roses and whiskers on kittens. Bright copper kettles and warm woollen mittens. Brown paper packages tied up with strings . These are a few of my favourite things.... ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I love the song My Favourite Things from my absolute, longtime favourite film The Sound of Music (I know every song and I‚Äôve seen it more than 50 times) so when Mariya from @lickthefrosting selected fabric designs for her liners, I had an inkling that these were some of the things she loves (especially since she‚Äôs half of two sisters‚Äô attempt to create magic out of butter, flour, and sugar, and who can argue with cake and cookies) üç™üç©üç∞üßÅü•ß. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. From top right to bottom left:. Teapots and teacups on red; blue green monstera leaves; garden herbs like basil and rosemary; cupcakes #becausecupcake; and little airplanes ‚úàÔ∏è üíõüòç. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. I love how the little things that we choose say big things about our hobbies, personality, beliefs. In addition to showing the things that we love, choosing a reusable pantyliner says ‚ÄúI know it‚Äôs a little less convenient than discarding because I‚Äôll need to wash it. But I *choose* comfort, health and to do my part to positively impact climate change.‚Äù Because every little counts.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #pantyliner #pantyliners #reusablepantyliners #liners #clothpantyliner #clothpad #reusablepad #reusablemenstrualproducts #rumps #reusable #reusables #climatechangeactions #reusableperiodproducts #zerowaste #zerowasteperiod #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesg #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #journeytozerowaste #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #saynotodisposables #zerowasteinspo #flatlay #consciouschoices #myfavouritethings #prettyperiods #happyperiod

*Unpaper wipes against stains and spills on my kitchen counter top*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. When I was choosing kitchen countertops, I made the mistake of selecting white. I really wanted an all white flat because the space is tiny, but it‚Äôs difficult to maintain. It‚Äôs much easier for one person (me) to keep it clean since I know what needs to be done and I take care to do it, but other people frequently don‚Äôt understand why I treat every spill with great urgency and importance. (I‚Äôd really like to change out my countertops to something requiring less care but that‚Äôs a different story üòâ.). ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. So I have a wipe that sits on top my kitchen sink faucet for these annoying little drips and spots that can‚Äôt be avoided.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Tea is a big annoyance (coffee‚Äôs easier to clean) as its tannins stain everything! If I don‚Äôt wipe spilled tea off the counter immediately, it‚Äôll take more time, chemicals and elbow grease to remove.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. In my family, we don‚Äôt use paper towels for eating surfaces. We use unpaper towel wipes called a ‚Äútoi bo‚Äù in Cantonese. The direct translation ‚Äútable cloth‚Äù ‚Äúdoes not do it justice. I‚Äôm not even sure what the Mandarin translation is, as I‚Äôve never heard the phrase in anything other than Cantonese ü§£üòÇüòÖ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Whatever you use, skip the disposable paper towel! And it‚Äôs not difficult to wash; if I spill curry, milk or anything sugary, it gets thoroughly hand washed immediately and set aside for the next load of  household linens for the washing machine.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. And with that, I‚Äôve spent far too long talking about my kitchen and my wipes ü§£ü§£ü§£. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. ##unpapertowel #unpapertowels #clothwipes #reusablecloth #reusablewipes #unpapers #reusablecloths #reusables #reusable #cloth #cloths #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastejourney zerowastelife #zerowastekitchen #zerowasteswaps #zerowasteinspo #zerowastehacks #zerowastelifehacks #zerowastecloths. saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reducingwaste #zerowastegram #flaylay #cleankitchen #reusablekitchenwipes

*Unpaper towel wipes ‚Äì in a brand new size*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. A couple of weeks ago, I did some dipstick consumer research and asked you guys about your unpaper towel usage patterns in order as I was thinking of sizing down from full paper towel size. I felt that I could size down because cotton cloth is more absorbant than paper, so that it would feel better in your hand and be less fiddly.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. While I say this research was dipstick, i have spent a lot of time talking to you guys and understanding your needs and usage patterns. There was about a 50-50 split between wiping and saving the wipe for reuse, and wiping and setting it aside for wash; slightly more people said you‚Äôd hand wash as you go than saving a batch and bulk washing; and most say that cleaning surfaces and wiping up small spills are more frequent than mopping up big spills!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. So here are the new unpaper towel wipes! They‚Äôre about an inch bigger all around an adult hand üñê (give or take depending on hand size). I think this will provide enough absorbency for everyday surface wiping and the occasional spill, while being small enough to dry in between wipes, especially if you hand wash on the go. They‚Äôll also make really good on-the-go wipes ü§óü§óü§ó. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My favourite  way of storing unpaper towels has to be the ‚Äútissue paper accordion fold.‚Äù I have a reusable tissue box that I bought for my reusables, and with this fold, as I take one sheet out of the box, the next sheet pulls out automatically. They‚Äôre really easy to fold too!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #unpapertowel #unpapertowels #clothwipes #reusablecloth #reusablewipes #unpapers #reusablecloths #reusables #reusable #cloth #cloths #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastejourney zerowastelife #zerowastekitchen #zerowasteswaps #zerowasteinspo #zerowastehacks #zerowastelifehacks #zerowastecloths. saynotosingleuse #saynotodisposables #reducingwaste #zerowastegram #flaylay

*Breakfast to go*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. What‚Äôs your typical brekkie? Mine is coffee. And I usually have a latte. Today I made myself a golden turmeric latte (with coffee, because sometimes a turmeric latte is just milk and turmeric, who really knows) and had some cherries because I‚Äôd already taken them out as props for this photo üòÇüòÇüòÇ. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. When I worked in an agency, I‚Äôd frequently take cut fruit to work that I‚Äôd eat mid morning, and stuff that I‚Äôd baked for an afternoon snack (pictured in the shark snack baggie: cookie brownies or crownies; Google ‚Äòcrownies Chubby Hubby‚Äô for the recipe üòã), and always coffee. Coffee is my ritual even if it doesn‚Äôt keep me awake.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. My snack baggies are lined with a certified food safe liner that‚Äôs water and grease proof. It‚Äôs also really easy to wash. If you‚Äôre in the office, you can simply flip it inside out and use a little dish washing liquid  and leave to air dry. As long as you keep the outer dry, it‚Äôll dry in under an hour, ready for the next snack before the day is over!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. *Hungry 30 minutes early!*. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Weekends always screw up my eating schedule. During the week, I typically have coffee for breakfast, lunch between 12 and 1, and dinner. On weekends, I tend to have brunch (a little earlier) and dinner a little later.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Last night just before a planned dinner with friends at 8, I got really hungry (about 30 minutes before dinner)! I was really tempted to get some fried mushrooms even though dinner was in half an hour! And I would have too, had I had my snack baggie with me üòãüòãüòã So it might not have been a bad thing that I didn‚Äôt ruin my dinner with my pre-dinner.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. At dinner, we got cocktails üç∏. Towards the end though, I was really thirsty and wanted water, but the establishment does not serve tap water (you have to buy bottled water). After dinner, we looked for a place for drinks. The first place we sat down at didn‚Äôt serve tap water either (and considering we were ordering alcohol, serving tap water should be a socially responsible thing to do). The only other occupied was extremely loud so we left and went somewhere else that did serve water, which was great because I was so thirsty.. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. But I‚Äôm really not talking about my dinner or drinks. I‚Äôm reflecting on how badly prepared I was yesterday and wondering why some food and beverage establishments don‚Äôt serve water (just tap will do, this is Singapore and it‚Äôs perfectly safe).. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. Aside from us as individuals bring prepared with our arsenal of reusables, wouldn‚Äôt it be great if the food industry helped reduce single-use PET bottled water? I‚Äôll gladly buy a coffee or an espresso martini!. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä. #snackbag #snackbaggie #reusablebag #reusablesnackbag #reusablefoodbag #reusablesandwichbag #foodbag #sandwichbag #reusable #reusables #saynotoclingwrap #saynotoplasticzipbags #saynotosingleuse #saynotosingleuseplastic #zerowaste #zerowastesg #zerowastesingapore #zerowastesnacking #zerowasteonthego #zerowastehacks #zerowasteinspo #zerowasteliving #zerowastemovement #zerowastelifestyle #zerowastefood #flatlay #eco
